info.game_comments: 2005 Ultimate Tournament of Champions Round 4, game 1.

(1, 1).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from the Nixon Library & Birthplace in Yorba Linda, CA.)  In 1970 this man dropped in at the White House, gave Nixon this gun & bullets, & asked to become a federal drug agent

(2, 1).clue: Robert Redford & Jane Fonda begin married life in a tiny walk-up Greenwich Village apartment in this 1967 comedy

(3, 1).clue: Don't get all stressed out by an EKG, which stands for this

(4, 1).clue: Don't wash dishes wearing your 1932 "Duo Dial" one of these from Longines

(5, 1).clue: The Grand Turk & the Friendship were the original ships pictured on this brand of toiletries for men

(1, 2).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew poses with a green telephone in the Nixon Library.)  In 1969, Nixon used this phone on what he called the most historic phone call ever made with these 2 men

(2, 2).clue: This Warren Beatty-Natalie Wood film about teen love & desire took its title from a Wordsworth poem

(3, 2).clue: This end-of-life legal decision is abbreviated DNR

(4, 2).clue: If you own one of these, made with the first successful photographic process, never try to polish it

(5, 2).clue: In 2003, this food brand unveiled its redesigned logo seen here

(6, 2).clue: Those choosing to play one of these creatures in Everquest 2 get a nice intelligence bonus

(1, 3).clue: There's a replica of the study in the ex-president's home in this state, kept as it was when he fell fatally ill

(2, 3).clue: George C. Scott lived the good life as a sculptor in the Bahamas in this movie based on a posthumous Hemingway novel

(3, 3).clue: The P in a PSA test, used to detect cancer in men, stands for this

(4, 3).clue: Designed in 1936, it makes holidays & other days special for collectors

(5, 3).clue: Gertrude the Kangaroo has long been the logo of this Simon & Schuster division

(1, 4).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reads the clue from the Nixon Library & Birthplace in Yorba Linda, CA.)  The library has a replica of this room that hosted Nixon's daughter's wedding reception & his farewell to his staff

(2, 4).clue: In this 1995 drama, Christian Slater takes on Kevin Bacon's defense after he's accused of killing a fellow inmate

(3, 4).clue: When talking about cholesterol, its the "D" in HDL & LDL

(4, 4).clue: From the Greek for "one day", campaign buttons & cruise ship menus are these items not meant to last

(5, 4).clue: This food brand has been hamming it up with its Little Red Devil trademark since 1870

(6, 4).clue: The 2 related words that mean to grind your teeth or to chew with them

(1, 5).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew points out the bust of a world leader in the Nixon Library & Birthplace in Yorba Linda, CA.)  World leaders at the library include this premier who greeted Nixon on his historic arrival in China

(2, 5).clue: On the verge of blindness, Bjork must save her son from a similar fate in this Cannes Film Festival winner from 2000

(3, 5).clue: CLL is the chronic lymphocytic type of this cancer

(4, 5).clue: Hang onto that sturdy c. 1930 glassware from this company's designers Vicke Lindstrand & Edvin Ohrstrom

(5, 5).clue: Dive into life with sportswear made by this company whose logo is seen here

(6, 5).clue: The bands seen here are typical of this

(1, 1).clue: Around 284 B.C. Zenodotus of Ephesus became the first superintendant of this city's library

(2, 1).clue: On '50s TV he played the man with badge 714

(4, 1).clue: Eliza crossing the frozen Ohio River barefoot is a memorable moment in this novel

(5, 1).clue: The John Paul II International Airport is in this country

(6, 1).clue: It comes in colorful 1-to-500-dollar denominations, & it's a metaphor for frivolous spending

(1, 2).clue: This "Great" Brit was the youngest son of King Ethelwulf

(2, 2).clue: Jose Melis was his "Tonight" show bandleader

(4, 2).clue: Colorful title of Anna Quindlen's tale of domestic violence

(5, 2).clue: Kahului Airport, in the town also called "Dream City", is a gateway to this second-biggest Hawaiian island

(6, 2).clue: In Melville's prose, with "ungraduated, instantaneous swiftness", it "darted through the weltering sea"

(1, 3).clue: Around 500 B.C. this Persian king built Persepolis; parts of the city's audience hall & palace are still standing

(2, 3).clue: In 1994 this "General Hospital" alum joined the cast of "Melrose Place"

(4, 3).clue: In "The Master", Colm Tóibín enters the mind of this great 19th & 20th century novelist

(5, 3).clue: The Flint, Michigan airport is named for Arthur Bishop, who was on this company's board for 29 years

(6, 3).clue: Playing on his nickname, in a close NBA game, coach Don Nelson might have been this type of anxious person

(1, 4).clue: In 1402 Ottoman Sultan Bayezid I was captured in the Battle of Ankara by this conqueror from Samarkand

(2, 4).clue: This fitness guru brought exercise to TV in 1951

(4, 4).clue: In April 2005 this Marilynne Robinson novel won the Pulitzer Prize

(5, 4).clue: Montreal's Dorval airport is now named for this late prime minister, a Montreal native

(6, 4).clue: Leviticus 23 says to bring these of your harvest to be presented to the Lord

(1, 5).clue: For defeating Hannibal in the Battle of Zama, ending the Second Punic War, Scipio was granted this Latin surname

(2, 5).clue: He played Sgt. Nick Yemana on "Barney Miller"

(4, 5).clue: Wintry title of Neal Stephenson's cyberpunk novel about a hacker/pizza deliveryman

(5, 5).clue: The airport at Latacunga in this country is called Cotopaxi, though the city has suffered from the Cotopaxi volcano

(6, 5).clue: Terminal term for the spot where a spy leaves secret papers or film

(0, 0).clue: This 5-word rule or maxim has been attributed to both H. Gordon Selfridge & John Wanamaker
